DeepCover v0.1.16
activesupport/lib/active_support/cache/file_store.rb
1# frozen_string_literal: true
2
3require "active_support/core_ext/marshal"
4require "active_support/core_ext/file/atomic"
5require "active_support/core_ext/string/conversions"
6require "uri/common"
7
8module ActiveSupport
9 module Cache
10 # A cache store implementation which stores everything on the filesystem.
11 #
12 # FileStore implements the Strategy::LocalCache strategy which implements
13 # an in-memory cache inside of a block.
14 class FileStore < Store
15 prepend Strategy::LocalCache
16 attr_reader :cache_path
17
18 DIR_FORMATTER = "%03X"
19 FILENAME_MAX_SIZE = 228 # max filename size on file system is 255, minus room for timestamp and random characters appended by Tempfile (used by atomic write)
20 FILEPATH_MAX_SIZE = 900 # max is 1024, plus some room
21 EXCLUDED_DIRS = [".", ".."].freeze
22 GITKEEP_FILES = [".gitkeep", ".keep"].freeze
23
24 def initialize(cache_path, options = nil)
25 super(options)
26 @cache_path = cache_path.to_s
27 end
28
29 # Deletes all items from the cache. In this case it deletes all the entries in the specified
30 # file store directory except for .keep or .gitkeep. Be careful which directory is specified in your
31 # config file when using +FileStore+ because everything in that directory will be deleted.
32 def clear(options = nil)
33 root_dirs = exclude_from(cache_path, EXCLUDED_DIRS + GITKEEP_FILES)
34 FileUtils.rm_r(root_dirs.collect { |f| File.join(cache_path, f) })
35 rescue Errno::ENOENT
36 end
37
38 # Preemptively iterates through all stored keys and removes the ones which have expired.
39 def cleanup(options = nil)
40 options = merged_options(options)
41 search_dir(cache_path) do |fname|
42 entry = read_entry(fname, options)
43 delete_entry(fname, options) if entry && entry.expired?
44 end
45 end
46
47 # Increments an already existing integer value that is stored in the cache.
48 # If the key is not found nothing is done.
49 def increment(name, amount = 1, options = nil)
50 modify_value(name, amount, options)
51 end
52
53 # Decrements an already existing integer value that is stored in the cache.
54 # If the key is not found nothing is done.
55 def decrement(name, amount = 1, options = nil)
56 modify_value(name, -amount, options)
57 end
58
59 def delete_matched(matcher, options = nil)
60 options = merged_options(options)
61 instrument(:delete_matched, matcher.inspect) do
62 matcher = key_matcher(matcher, options)
63 search_dir(cache_path) do |path|
64 key = file_path_key(path)
65 delete_entry(path, options) if key.match(matcher)
66 end
67 end
68 end
69
70 private
71
72 def read_entry(key, options)
73 if File.exist?(key)
74 File.open(key) { |f| Marshal.load(f) }
75 end
76 rescue => e
77 logger.error("FileStoreError (#{e}): #{e.message}") if logger
78 nil
79 end
80
81 def write_entry(key, entry, options)
82 return false if options[:unless_exist] && File.exist?(key)
83 ensure_cache_path(File.dirname(key))
84 File.atomic_write(key, cache_path) { |f| Marshal.dump(entry, f) }
85 true
86 end
87
88 def delete_entry(key, options)
89 if File.exist?(key)
90 begin
91 File.delete(key)
92 delete_empty_directories(File.dirname(key))
93 true
94 rescue => e
95 # Just in case the error was caused by another process deleting the file first.
96 raise e if File.exist?(key)
97 false
98 end
99 end
100 end
101
102 # Lock a file for a block so only one process can modify it at a time.
103 def lock_file(file_name, &block)
104 if File.exist?(file_name)
105 File.open(file_name, "r+") do |f|
106 begin
107 f.flock File::LOCK_EX
108 yield
109 ensure
110 f.flock File::LOCK_UN
111 end
112 end
113 else
114 yield
115 end
116 end
117
118 # Translate a key into a file path.
119 def normalize_key(key, options)
120 key = super
121 fname = URI.encode_www_form_component(key)
122
123 if fname.size > FILEPATH_MAX_SIZE
124 fname = Digest::MD5.hexdigest(key)
125 end
126
127 hash = Zlib.adler32(fname)
128 hash, dir_1 = hash.divmod(0x1000)
129 dir_2 = hash.modulo(0x1000)
130 fname_paths = []
131
132 # Make sure file name doesn't exceed file system limits.
133 begin
134 fname_paths << fname[0, FILENAME_MAX_SIZE]
135 fname = fname[FILENAME_MAX_SIZE..-1]
136 end until fname.blank?
137
138 File.join(cache_path, DIR_FORMATTER % dir_1, DIR_FORMATTER % dir_2, *fname_paths)
139 end
140
141 # Translate a file path into a key.
142 def file_path_key(path)
143 fname = path[cache_path.to_s.size..-1].split(File::SEPARATOR, 4).last
144 URI.decode_www_form_component(fname, Encoding::UTF_8)
145 end
146
147 # Delete empty directories in the cache.
148 def delete_empty_directories(dir)
149 return if File.realpath(dir) == File.realpath(cache_path)
150 if exclude_from(dir, EXCLUDED_DIRS).empty?
151 Dir.delete(dir) rescue nil
152 delete_empty_directories(File.dirname(dir))
153 end
154 end
155
156 # Make sure a file path's directories exist.
157 def ensure_cache_path(path)
158 FileUtils.makedirs(path) unless File.exist?(path)
159 end
160
161 def search_dir(dir, &callback)
162 return if !File.exist?(dir)
163 Dir.foreach(dir) do |d|
164 next if EXCLUDED_DIRS.include?(d)
165 name = File.join(dir, d)
166 if File.directory?(name)
167 search_dir(name, &callback)
168 else
169 callback.call name
170 end
171 end
172 end
173
174 # Modifies the amount of an already existing integer value that is stored in the cache.
175 # If the key is not found nothing is done.
176 def modify_value(name, amount, options)
177 file_name = normalize_key(name, options)
178
179 lock_file(file_name) do
180 options = merged_options(options)
181
182 if num = read(name, options)
183 num = num.to_i + amount
184 write(name, num, options)
185 num
186 end
187 end
188 end
189
190 # Exclude entries from source directory
191 def exclude_from(source, excludes)
192 Dir.entries(source).reject { |f| excludes.include?(f) }
193 end
194 end
195 end
196end
